steps.description: This will allow you to identify which processes are using excessive CPU resources.
In Task Manager, click on the 'CPU' column to sort processes by CPU usage in descending order. This helps identify the process(es) consuming the most CPU.
Look for unfamiliar or suspicious processes. If you identify a specific application or service causing high CPU usage, consider closing or uninstalling it.
High CPU usage could be caused by malware. Run a full system scan using your antivirus software to detect and remove any malicious software.
Corrupted system files can cause high CPU usage. Running SFC will scan and replace corrupted system files.
If the issue started recently, you can restore your system to a previous point when it was functioning correctly.
As a last resort, if none of the above steps resolve the issue, reinstalling Windows will reset your system to a clean state.
